intro: Plectritis ciliosa var. patelliformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are small and yellowish-green. It is a perennial species that produces seeds through a unique mechanism involving a specialized floral structure.
